au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikStructure2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikStructure2D

  • public class FabrikStructure2D
extends Object
    A FabrikStructure2D contains one or more FabrikChain2D objects, which we can solve using the FABRIK (Forward And Backward Reaching Inverse Kinematics) algorithm for specified target locations.

    The FabrikStructure2D class is merely a convenient holder for an ArrayList of FabrikChain2D objects which allows multiple chains to have their target location updated, as well as drawing the multiple chains attached to the FabrikStructure2D object, using a single method call.

    Chains in a structure may be connected to other chains in the same structure in a variety of ways, if desired.

    Version:
    0.9.1 - 29/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

      • setName

      • updateTarget

        public void updateTarget(Vec2f newTargetLocation)
        Update the target location for this FabrikStructure2D, and hence the target of all chains attached to this structure.

        The result of running this method is that each FabrikChain2D has its updateTarget method called, which in turn calls the chain's solveIK method to attempt to solve the IK chain for the new target location.

        Parameters:
        newTargetLocation - The location of the target for which we will attempt to solve all chains attached to this structure.

      • updateTarget

        public void updateTarget(float targetXLocation,
                         float targetYLocation)
        Method to update the target location for a FabrikStructure2D, and hence all the target of all chains attached to this structure.

        After this method has been executed, the state of all IK chains attached to this structure will have been updated.

        Internally, this method simply constructs a Vec2f from the provided x and y values and calls the Vec2f version of this method.

        Parameters:
        targetXLocation - (float) The horizontal location of the target for which we will solve all chains attached to this structure.
        targetYLocation - (float) The vertical location of the target for which we will solve all chains attached to this structure.

      • addChain

        public void addChain(FabrikChain2D chain)
        Add a FabrikChain2D object to a FabrikStructure2D object.

        Adding a chain using this method adds the chain to the structure, but does not connect it to any existing chain in the structure. However, all chains in a structure share the same target, and all chains in the structure can be solved for the target location via a single call to updateTarget on this structure.

        Parameters:
        chain - (FabrikChain2D) The FabrikChain2D to add to this structure.
        See Also:
        updateTarget

      • addConnectedChain

        public void addConnectedChain(FabrikChain2D chain,
                              int chainNumber,
                              int boneNumber)
        Add a chain to this structure which is connected to a specific bone of an existing chain in this structure.

        When connecting a chain to an existing chain in a structure, the multiple chains will all share the same target location / end effector.

        The location of the bones in the chain to be connected should be specified relative to the origin (0.0f, 0.0f), not relative to the current location of connection point in the chain being connected to. On connection, all bones are translated (that is, moved horizontally and vertically) so that they're positioned relative to the end location of the specified bone in the specified chain.

        Both chains within the structure and bones within a chain are zero. If the chainNumber or boneNumber specified do not exist then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        chain - The chain to connect to this structure
        chainNumber - The zero indexed number of the chain to connect the provided chain to.
        boneNumber - The zero indexed number of the bone within the specified chain to connect the provided chain to.

      • addConnectedChain

        public void addConnectedChain(FabrikChain2D chain,
                              int chainNumber,
                              int boneNumber,
                              FabrikChain2D.BoneConnectionPoint2D boneConnectionPoint)
        Connect a chain to an existing chain in the structure.
        Parameters:
        chain - The chain which we will connect to this structure.
        chainNumber - The zero-indexed number of the pre-existing chain in this structure that the new chain will attach to.
        boneNumber - The zero-indexed number of bone in the pre-existing chain in this structure that the new chain will attach to.
        boneConnectionPoint - Whether to attach the new chain to the start or end point of the bone we are connecting to.

      • getNumChains

        public int getNumChains()
        Return the number of chains in this structure.

        The number of chains in this structure.

      • getChain

        public FabrikChain2D getChain(int chainNumber)
        Return a chain which exists in this structure.

        Note: Chains are zero-indexed.

        Parameters:
        chainNumber - The zero-indexed chain in this structure to return.
        Returns:
        The desired chain.

      • setFixedBaseMode

        public void setFixedBaseMode(boolean fixedBaseMode)
        Set the fixed-base mode on the first chain in this structure. If disabling fixed-base mode and the first chain has a BaseBoneConstraintType of GLOBAL_ABSOLUTE then a RuntimeException will be thrown as this these options are mutually exclusive.
        Parameters:
        fixedBaseMode - Whether we want this structure to operate in fixed-base mode (true) or not (false).

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return a concise, human readable description of this FabrikStructure2D.

        If further details on a specific chain are required, then you should get and print each chain individually.

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
